title: Dump the Character Standard for Baseball’s Hall of Fame
sub_head: Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens aren’t saints, but other inductees weren’t either during their careers.
body:
Major League Baseball is untidy these days. The players union and the owners are in a labor imbroglio, with the owners having “locked out” the players, which imperils the scheduled opening of the season in April.
Meanwhile, the National Baseball Hall of Fame announced the election of Boston Red Sox slugger David Ortiz, but Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens failed to get the requisite 75% of the votes by the Baseball Writers’ Association of America in the final year of their 10-year election eligibility.
